dublin_core.dcvalue: We describe the feasibility of audio enhanced personal digital assistants ADPAs for data collection with 60 Latino migrant farmworkers All participants chose to complete APDA surveys rather than using paper and pencil No one left the study prematurely two 3 data cases were lost due to technical difficulties Across all data 27 missing data were observed nine missing responses on eight items Participants took 19 minutes on average to complete the 58 question survey The factor most influential for completion was education level APDA methodology enabled both English and Spanish speaking Latino migrant farmworkers to become active research participants with minimal loss of data
Evaluation of the use of audio-enhanced personal digital assistants to survey Latino migrant farmworkers.
